body:
Hi,

When installing a package with spack, I can have a look at the log file in case there is a problem with the installation. Is there also a good way to keep the log file, if there was no problem with the installation ?

I tohugh about the "dirty" option in the config.yaml file, but this is not exactly what I am looking for, because it also does not cleanup the environment. I would like to just keep the logfile of the installation.
title: What is the easiest way to keep the log file for successfully built packages ?
